verses.text: "Two things I ask of you, O LORD; do not refuse me before I die:

rsbNotes.title: Pr 30:7–9
rsbNotes.text: 30:7–9 This prayer reflects a desire to learn from the kind of wisdom that is in Proverbs.

verses.text: Keep falsehood and lies far from me; give me neither poverty nor riches, but give me only my daily bread.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 30:8
rsbNotes.text: 30:8 the food that is needful for me. The request is for a sufficiency that avoids both extremes of poverty and unnecessary riches.

verses.text: Otherwise, I may have too much and disown you and say, 'Who is the LORD?' Or I may become poor and steal, and so dishonor the name of my God.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 30:9
rsbNotes.text: 30:9 Who is the Lord. People who have an excess of material possessions soon forget their dependence on the Lord (Deut. 8:10–18; Luke 12:16–21).
